'in these' means it doesn't yet exist

if you need a clearer table e-mail me and i'll send you my excel file.

I'm gonna talk about this as if it will really happen because it does have a 
possibility of happening: if the editor goes well and we get privileges from 
FSGames we could make G:BF and then we would (hopefully) use this as a guide 
to make the characters. As you see, Tower, Golem, and Orc need more 
abilities, especially tower.

I have two problems with this, the latter one the more important:

1) I think there should have to be a set # of abilities for each character, 
either 3 or 4, and that each character should have only one ability with an 
alternate because as it is an Archer has 3 abilities while a Cleric has 7.

2) A major problem with this is that whenever we add abilities to Ghost, 
Skeleton or Elemental we're giving just as big a boost to Clerics, Mages and 
Archmages, the 3 strongest characters (I don't include faerie on this list 
because druid's are due for a boost anyway). there are 3 ways of dealing 
with this. we could:
   A) get rid of all summon abilities except summon faerie and summon image. 
This would also help solve the 1st problem but would seriously cripple an 
interesting type of ability
   B) leave Elemental, Ghost and Skeleton as they were in the last game, 
make them unhireable or really cheap second tear characters
   C) create 2 types of Elementals, Ghosts and Skeletons, a 'normal' type 
(new one) and a 'summoned' type (old one) this one is my preference because 
it keeps the new abilities but doesn't strengthen the already too-strong 
characters. The problem with this is that it complicates things for new 
players to have 2 types of the same character running around.

on my excel file i also include info about the group three characters which 
i won't include here cuz it takes up too much room. But i think that the 
rule about having 3-4 abilities per character should apply to them too. i 
will start here with my goblin:

attack 1: suicidal charge*: doubles your attack and speed for the duration. 
at the end of the attack you die. if you finish the level in the middle of 
the attack you survive

attack 2: taunt: like thief but without reverse

attack 3: battle cry: adds to your hp (the # of team members x your level)

1 problem with having so many new characters is that all the choices will 
confuse newbee's, so maybe you should only start with the ability to hire 
characters that are available in the unregistered version and get a new 
character every 1 or 2 levels.

i don't thing the practical mage or high priest characters are a good idea 
because again they are improving an already too good character type. On the 
other hand something like assassin (from thief) would be very good. i would 
have nothing against practical mage being a hired character class. Assassin: 
throws knives like a thief

attack 1: drop caltraps: like drop bomb only deals less damage and is 
permanent, dealing damage to everyone who steps in the square. You could 
program npc's not to go around a square with them because they were very 
hard to see.

attack 2: cloak: same as thief

attack 3: Pick lock: opens any door

attack 4: back stab: only works when invisible (cloaked or potion); doubles 
the attack for 1 attack then he looses his invisibility (maybe only if he 
was cloaked)

Now the programming project:

Sadly, I have absolutely no knowledge of any programming languages but as i 
said before i can be a tester. i don't have much experience with that either 
but i know quite a few people that have played glad before  who could test 
it as well.  I also have an unused web page on homestead that we could use 
to put up the editor on-line.

if we do make G:BF i could help with the nonprograming designing.

This was the longest letter i've ever written to this group. i hope to be 
very active for the next month but then i'm going to America for a month and 
may not be able to get web access very much (poor country, you know).
